metadata.synopsis: This dialog is started by talking to the Butcher character in the Colony. The player may ask the Butcher questions or recruit them as a temporary follower inside the Colony. Alternatively, this dialog runs through a flag in case the player has already met the Butcher, or if the Butcher was recruited as a follower. The Butcher sounds eerily vacant unless otherwise specified, his mind destroyed by his time in Colony.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter the kitchen on the lower floor of the Colony, and talk to the Butcher. The Butcher can be found at 738 -38 -109 in SCL_Main_A.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *No will sparks behind his eyes. His mind has been hollowed out, to better echo the commands of the collective.*
37.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

6.speaker: Player
6.text: A ghaik thrall. The only way to save it is to kill it.
6.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: A ghaik thrall. The only way to save it is to kill it.
19.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

5.speaker: Player
5.text: *You could kill it, end its miserable life of enslavement. Surely that would be the humane thing to do...*
5.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *You could kill it, end its miserable life of enslavement. Surely that would be the humane thing to do...*
24.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Or you could take advantage of its vulnerability and plunder what's left of its hollow mind for anything that could serve you.*
9.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

25.speaker: Player
25.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *Pliant as well-worn boots, his mind turns to his work. Chop. Cut. Sort.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Shiver of impact. Crack of bone. He removes the brains, digs free the squirming tadpoles. The unworthy ones, given over to the illithids. To become.*

20.speaker: Player
20.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

42.speaker: Chop
42.text: Part of One Mind. Four little feet. Dancing. To same song.
42.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each sentence

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *With a lurch, you realise he means the intellect devourers. Here the brains are harvested - made part of the hivemind.*
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tilting his head at us in vacant confusion / interest

13.speaker: Chop
13.text: But there is one. Little. Kitty. Dances. To another song.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tilting his head at us in vacant confusion / interest

55.speaker: Chop
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tilting his head at us in vacant confusion / interest

10.speaker: Player
10.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each word

1.speaker: Chop
1.context: NodeContext: Vacant; a decent pause between each word

39.speaker: Player
39.text: What did you do to all these people?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Where can I find this 'Little Kitty'?

59.speaker: Chop
59.text: Locked. Up. Bad kitty. Thinks it is. Other.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: About that creature in the cage...

54.speaker: Chop
54.text: Bad kitty. Sings wrong song. Must-fix.

27.speaker: Player
27.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

43.speaker: Chop
43.text: Cut. Chop. Until it is us again.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Let it come with me. We sing the same song.
29.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

32.speaker: Chop
32.text: ...Yes. Yes. I hear. Go then. Make. Happy?
32.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

33.speaker: Chop
33.text: ...Yes. Yes. I hear. Go then. Make. Happy?

18.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

12.speaker: Chop
12.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

57.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Let it come with me. We sing the same song.
60.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'll take the creature with me. It won't disrupt the hivemind anymore.
45.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

23.speaker: Chop
23.text: ...Yes. Yes. Take - only One song remains.
23.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

11.speaker: Chop
11.text: ...Yes. Yes. Take - only One song remains.

52.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

56.speaker: Chop
56.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Free the creature or I'll kill you and every one of your creations.
22.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

50.speaker: Chop
50.text: No. No. Kitties good. Sing One song. Take other. Away!
50.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

28.speaker: Chop
28.text: No. No. Kitties good. Sing One song. Take other. Away!

16.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

53.speaker: Chop
53.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

34.speaker: Chop
34.context: NodeContext: Confusion and denial building into rage - attacking after node

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Do as you will with it.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: About the 'little kitty' in the cage...
4.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the only moment where he becomes almost lucid/emotiveNodeContext: Breathlessly/suddenly audibly fearful, almost sobbing - before immediately returning to being monosyllabic once this line is over

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I need to find your master - Ketheric.
38.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the only moment where he becomes almost lucid/emotiveNodeContext: Breathlessly/suddenly audibly fearful, almost sobbing - before immediately returning to being monosyllabic once this line is over

2.speaker: Chop
2.text: Down. Deep. One of Three. One of Three.
2.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the only moment where he becomes almost lucid/emotiveNodeContext: Breathlessly/suddenly audibly fearful, almost sobbing - before immediately returning to being monosyllabic once this line is over

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Why don't I send you to join all these creatures you butchered?
